intro: Blepharis dhofarensis, commonly known as the Dhofar blepharis, is a flowering plant native to the southern Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its flowering period occurs during the rainy season, and it is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low water availability. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
